thread.title: 'Mommy blogger' accused of injecting daughter with urine
thread.title_full: 'Mommy blogger' accused of injecting daughter with urine - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: 'Mommy blogger' accused of injecting daughter with urine
text:
istockphoto An Australian 'mommy blogger' is accused of injecting her daughter with urine. Photographer: Jacky Teh/Jacky Teh via iStock The mom was apparently frustrated with her efforts to treat her child. Previous Next Enlarge A "mommy blogger" is accused of harming her daughter by injecting her with urine in an attempt to get her doctor "to treat" the child, according to ABC in Australia .
The woman, who is not being identified by authorities, was apparently frustrated with her failed attempts to help the girl, who was born with a genetic illness. The mother's suspicious behavior goes back to 2008, the station reported.
"I wanted him [the doctor] to treat her," the mom wrote in her blog, which has now been removed, according to ABC. "Do something. Anything. She was in pain and I could see she was becoming unwell."
Authorities say that the girl's veinous line found to be contaminated by urine in March. The mother has also been accused of laxative abuse.
The child is the face of several well-known charities, according to ABC. She even reportedly danced in the Sydney Opera House.
"Because [the child] is such an adorable-looking child they used her for publicity, she was on big banners at the airport," a friend of the mother's who identified herself as Karen told ABC.
Karen said she was stunned to hear about the allegations.
"My first reaction when I heard that the police were involved in my friend's case, I was horrified, I couldn't believe it at all," she told ABC. "She's the last person I would expect to ever, ever do anything to any of her children."
dboroff@nydailynews.com
